ai-ud6.7:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud6.7:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Subhūti was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight, and mindfulness established right there.
ai-ud6.7:2.1_0: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ai-ud6.7:3.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud6.7:4.2_0: Totally cut (them) off within himself without remainder,
ai-ud6.7:4.4_0: having overcome the four yokes, they are not born again.”
